headline: Dollar Tree, Nebius, Palantir: Trending Tickers
summary: Dollar Tree's (DLTR) stronger-than-expected first quarter results are sending the stock higher, despite warnings of expected tariff impacts in the second quarter. Nebius Group (NBIS) stock surges after the company announced it secured $1 billion for its artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure plans. Palantir (PLTR) stock falls as the company's opportunity to help the US government collect data on Americans garners criticism from both sides of the political spectrum. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why Dollar Tree Stock Was Racing Higher on Thursday
summary: Dollar Tree (NASDAQ: DLTR) stock was adding a few dollars to its stock price as the Thursday trading session approached closing time.  Although investors weren't impressed by the quarterly earnings report the company posted the previous morning, sentiment improved thanks to price target raises -- and even one recommendation upgrade -- by analysts Thursday.  Dollar Tree's share price was more than 8% higher in mid-afternoon action, contrasting very favorably with the 0.2% dip of the S&P 500 index.

Dollar Tree's share price was more than 8% higher in mid-afternoon action, contrasting very favorably with the 0.2% dip of the S&P 500 index.

headline: Dollar Tree Stock Is S&P 500’s Best Today. It Gets an Upgrade.
summary: Dollar Tree  was the top-performing stock in the  on Thursday, climbing sharply just one day after shares plummeted following the discount retailer’s first-quarter earnings report.  Dollar Tree  received a boost from J.P. Morgan analyst Matthew Boss, who issued a research note upgrading the stock to Overweight from Neutral and lifting his price target to $111 from $72.  Dollar Tree  stock was up 8.9% to $96.48 on Thursday, clawing back all of its losses of 8.4% and more from the prior session, when investors sold off shares after management warned that the company could take a near-term hit from tariffs.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree Stock Is S&P 500’s Best Today. It Gets an Upgrade.

Dollar Tree  stock was up 8.9% to $96.48 on Thursday, clawing back all of its losses of 8.4% and more from the prior session, when investors sold off shares after management warned that the company could take a near-term hit from tariffs.

headline: Morning Movers: Chart Industries, Flowserve both rise following merger pact
summary: Stock market futures are slightly lower this morning as investors digest a mix of tariff and jobs concerns. Traders are focused on the labor market this week, with jobless claims and the May employment report on the horizon.
